intro: Timonius morobensis, commonly known as the Morobe timonius, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Morobe in Papua New Guinea. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Its leaves are usually broad and oval, with a smooth texture and a slightly waxy surface. Timonius morobensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and limited geographic distribution.
